data.name: CheckForUpdateQuestion
data.value: Would you like to check for an update now?

data.name: ShuttingdownDesc
data.value: Are you sure you want to quit?

data.name: STR_HELP_COMPONENT_TESTS
data.value: Select one of the following tests to check the associated sub-system.

data.name: STR_HELP_EMPTY_LOG_DETAIL
data.value: The log detail for this test instance is empty.

data.name: STR_HELP_FOLLOWING_TESTS_PERFORMED
data.value: The following tests will be performed:

data.name: STR_HELP_SYSTEM_EXTENSIVE_TEST1
data.value: The System Extensive Test will check your system to make sure that the main components are functioning properly.

data.name: STR_HELP_SYSTEM_EXTENSIVE_TEST2
data.value: It provides a more comprehensive test than the System Quick Test.

data.name: STR_HELP_SYSTEM_EXTENSIVE_TEST_DISABLE_SLEEP
data.value: Ensure sleep mode is disabled in the system's Power Options while performing this test.

data.name: STR_HELP_SYSTEM_FAST_TEST1
data.value: The System Fast Test will perform a fast check of your system to make sure that the main components are functioning properly.

data.name: STR_HELP_SYSTEM_TEST5
data.value: The Extensive Test may take 2 or more hours to complete.

data.name: STR_HELP_URL
data.value: For more information and updates, please visit www.hp.com/go/techcenter/PCDiags.

data.name: STR_HELP_URL2
data.value: For more information and updates, please visit %s.

data.name: STR_RESULT_ESC_MESSAGE_TEST_LOGS
data.value: These results are saved in the Test Logs which can be accessed from the Main Menu.

data.name: STR_RESULT_FAILURE_INDICATION
data.value: Please use the Failure ID code above when contacting HP Support.

data.name: SubmitWarrantyCode
data.value: Please click a Failure ID to submit it online to HP Support

data.name: TS_ApplicationNotAvailable
data.value: The application will not be available while a scheduled scan is running.

data.name: TS_ChooseToEnable
data.value: If you choose to enable automatic hardware scans the next scan will run %d

data.name: TS_KeepOrDisable
data.value: You may choose to keep the automatic scan scheduled as is or you may choose to disable it.

data.name: TS_NewScanScheduled
data.value: A new automatic hardware scan has been scheduled.

data.name: TS_NextScanIsScheduled
data.value: The next automated scan is scheduled to run %d

data.name: TS_NoScansScheduled
data.value: There are currently no automatic hardware scans scheduled.

data.name: TS_ScanWillRunFastSystemTest
data.value: The scheduled scan will automatically run the System Scan.

data.name: TS_SystemOff
data.value: If the system is off when the scan is scheduled it will attempt to run at the next available opportunity.

data.name: UpdateNotice
data.value: We noticed that it has been some time since you have checked for updates.

data.name: STR_CUSTOMER_FEEDBACK_ASSISTANCE
data.value: For further assistance please use HP PC Hardware Diagnostics Windows to contact technical support.

data.name: STR_CUSTOMER_FEEDBACK_INDIVIDUAL
data.value: We are not answering individual comments, but your feedback will help us improve our products and services.

data.name: STR_HP_SUPPORT_DISCLAIMER_PROMPT
data.value: Allow HP to use your HP PC information, including the serial number, product number and warranty information of the PC.

data.name: F30140_Key4
data.value: Click on the About button to find out more details about each test.

data.name: F30140_Key16
data.value: The hardware component tested for this audio test failed. This issue could be resolved running the Microsoft Troubleshoot Sound Problems and/or related to configuration of the audio playback device.

data.name: F30140_Key36
data.value: It appears that one of your buttons wasn’t clicked, please confirm.

data.name: F30140_Key37
data.value: I clicked the button but it does not work.

data.name: F30140_Key35
data.value: Click on the correct option below

data.name: F30140_Key26
data.value: Some keys may be colored gray in the on–screen display (e.g. the fn key).

data.name: Combined_Key_Operations
data.value: These keys may still be used for combined-key operations

data.name: F30140_Key27
data.value: Due to system settings you may need to hold down the Fn key for the F1-F12 keys to register properly.

data.name: F30140_Key33
data.value: I pressed these keys multiple times

data.name: F30140_Key32
data.value: It seems keys %s were pressed multiple times, please confirm they are working as expected.

data.name: F30140_Key13
data.value: Please use the Microsoft Network Adapter Troubleshooter to help determine the next best course of action.

data.name: F30140_Key23
data.value: Press the keys on your keyboard one by one until they all light up green on screen, or another color when pressed multiple times.

data.name: F30140_Key24
data.value: Select FINISH if all keys have been pressed and your keyboard exactly matches the layout shown on screen.

data.name: F30140_Key25
data.value: Select SKIP if all keys have been pressed but some keys shown on the screen are not physically present on your keyboard.

data.name: F30140_Key5
data.value: Click the %s button to start testing.

data.name: F30140_Key10
data.value: The PC hardware required for this is not detected or available.

data.name: F30140_Key14
data.value: The hardware component tested for this audio test PASSED, there were no issues found. If you are still experiencing issues with your sound make sure the Sound playback device is configured as the output device. This can be done in the Sound settings. In Windows, type sound into the Search bar.

data.name: F30140_Key17
data.value: Visit the HP support site for additional guidance on how to resolve this using the HP Virtual Agent.

data.name: F30140_Key28
data.value: It seems keys %s were not pressed, please confirm they are not reacting.

data.name: F30140_Key30
data.value: I did not press these keys

data.name: F30140_Key31
data.value: I don’t have these keys on my keyboard

data.name: F30140_Key34
data.value: Use the left or right mouse button (as indicated) to drag the orange boxes onto the grey boxes following the path as indicated by the arrow.

data.name: F30140_Key38
data.value: I did not click the button

data.name: F30140_Key8
data.value: Additional tests including memory test are available in HP PC Hardware Diagnostics UEFI.

data.name: F30140_Key9
data.value: Some tests may not be available in HP PC Hardware Diagnostics Windows.

data.name: ApplicationPurpose
data.value: HP PC Hardware Diagnostics Windows is a Windows-based utility that allows you to run diagnostic tests to determine if the computer hardware is functioning properly. The tool runs within the Windows operating system in order to diagnose hardware failures.

data.name: STR_AUDIO_NO_SOUND_COMPUTER
data.value: HP Desktop PCs - No Sound from the Computer (Windows 10)

data.name: STR_AUDIO_NO_SOUND_SPEAKERS
data.value: HP Notebook PCs - No Sound from Speakers (Windows 10)

data.name: STR_AUDIO_PB_SPEAKERS
data.value: The test found a problem playing audio or sounds from the speakers.

data.name: STR_CONNECT_SPEAKERS
data.value: Unplug and reconnect the speakers to the computer.

data.name: STR_CONNECT_MICROPHONES
data.value: Unplug and reconnect the microphones to the computer.

data.name: STR_AUDIO_PB_MICROPHONES
data.value: The test found a problem recording sounds.

data.name: STR_DID_ADDITIONAL_GUIDANCE
data.value: Did additional steps resolve your issue?

data.name: STR_DISCONNECT_DISPLAY
data.value: Try disconnecting the display or monitor and reconnecting it. If possible, try removing and reseating the graphics card and cables.

data.name: STR_DISPLAY_PB_ADAPTER
data.value: The test found a problem with the display adapter. The adapter or the system board may need to be replaced.

data.name: STR_FOLLOWING_DOCUMENTS_AVAILABLE
data.value: The following documents are available for reference:

data.name: STR_HAVE_ADDITIONAL_GUIDANCE
data.value: Have additional guidance steps been taken?

data.name: STR_KBD_REPLACE
data.value: The test found a problem with the keyboard. The keyboard may need to be replaced.

data.name: STR_KBD_TRY_DIFF
data.value: Try the test again using a different keyboard if possible.

data.name: STR_KBD_WIRED_TROUBLE
data.value: HP Desktop PCs - Wired Keyboard Troubleshooting (Windows 10, 8)

data.name: STR_KBD_WIRELESS_CONNECT_ISSUES
data.value: HP PCs - Wireless Keyboard and Mouse Connection Issues

data.name: STR_MOUSE_BUTTON_PB
data.value: The test found a problem with the mouse button. The mouse may need to be replaced.

data.name: STR_MOUSE_MOVE_SENSOR
data.value: The test found a problem with the mouse movement sensor. The mouse may need to be replaced.

data.name: STR_MOUSE_TRY_DIFF
data.value: Try the test again using a different mouse if possible.

data.name: STR_PLEASE_GUIDANCE
data.value: Be sure that additional guidance steps have been taken.

data.name: STR_ALLOW_HP
data.value: Allow HP to use your HP PC information, including serial number, product number and warranty information.

data.name: STR_CLICK_PRIVACY
data.value: Click HP Privacy Statement for more information.

data.name: STR_FOR_ASSISTANCE
data.value: For assistance, you may do any of the following:

data.name: STR_IF_PC_OFFLINE
data.value: If your PC is offline, use your phone to scan the provided QR Code and access HP Customer Support.

data.name: STR_IF_PC_ONLINE
data.value: If your PC is online, click Next to visit the HP Customer Support website.

data.name: STR_IF_TALKING
data.value: If you are talking to an HP Customer Support person, read aloud or copy and paste the provided Failure ID and Product ID.

data.name: String7
data.value: The Diagnostic has been launched. Please follow the steps and provide feedback when done.

data.name: STR_CUSTOMER_FEEDBACK_WELCOME
data.value: Thank you for using HP PC Hardware Diagnostics Windows. Please answer the question below.

data.name: STR_CLICK_CONTAC_HP
data.value: Select Contact HP Support for further action.

data.name: STR_CLICK_MORE_INFORMATION
data.value: Select More info for more information.

data.name: STR_WEBCAM_PB
data.value: The test found a problem with the webcam.

data.name: TaskWeeklyTrigger
data.value: Scheduled at %startTime% every %dayOfWeek% of every week.

data.name: TaskWeeklyTriggerInterval
data.value: Scheduled at %startTime% every %dayOfWeek% of every %weeksInterval% weeks.

data.name: BiosUpdateInternetConnection
data.value: The BIOS update retrieves the latest BIOS version available for this platform using an internet connection to access HP site.

data.name: BiosUpdateCheckForBiosUpdateOption
data.value: Select 'Check for BIOS update' to retrieve the latest BIOS version available for this platform.

data.name: BiosUpdateUpdateAndRebootOption
data.value: If an update is available, you will be prompted with an option to 'Update and reboot'. Select this option to initiate the BIOS update.

data.name: AcknowledgeToContinue
data.value: Please read and select the checkbox to continue.

data.name: BiosDateConsumerProduct
data.value: Check for windows updates to find out if you need to update the system BIOS.

data.name: RunCheckForUpdates
data.value: Do you want to check for Windows updates now?

data.name: BiosUpdateDisclaimer
data.value: Updating the BIOS requires temporarily suspending BitLocker to flash the firmware. Your system will need to restart to complete the process. Do not interrupt the update process once initiated. Be sure to save your work prior to initiating the update.

data.name: BiosUpdateNeedAcknowledgement
data.value: Please acknowledge the following information to proceed.

data.name: BiosUpdateFlashInProgress
data.value: Flashing in progress. Do not interrupt this process. Your system will reboot automatically once the flash completes.

data.name: BiosUpdateNotNeeded
data.value: Your BIOS is up to date. Select 'Ok' to continue.

data.name: BiosUpdateError
data.value: Failed to retrieve information for your product. This can happen if the HP server is unreachable. Please try again later.
